Detailed Description

A message service to alert listeners when peer component activities within CCA purview occur.

Used to generate and publish events. This service is to be immediately available during a setServices call. This service interface is compatible with a direct-connected or proxy framework.

Member Function Documentation

ComponentFactoryEvent ccaffeine.ports.ContextEventPublisherService.createComponentFactoryEvent (  in gov.cca.ComponentID  factoryID,
in gov.cca.TypeMap  factoryPortProperties,
in ContextEventType  cet,
in gov.cca.ComponentID  source,
in int  sourceKey
) 
 

Make factory events.

Factories are not themselves responsible for generating these events, though they may if they wish to.

Parameters:
factoryID the factory component.
factoryPortProperties the new factory port being announced.
cet is one of FactoryPortAdded, FactoryPortRemovePending.
source the component making the announcement.
sourceKey emitter id within the component making the announcement.

ComponentInstanceAddedEvent ccaffeine.ports.ContextEventPublisherService.createComponentInstanceAddedEvent (  in string  componentClassName,
in gov.cca.ComponentID  cid,
in gov.cca.ComponentID  source,
in int  sourceKey
) 
 

Make instance added notice.

NOTE- event type is only ComponentAdded.

Parameters:
componentClassName fully qualified class name of the component created.
cid the instance added.
source the component making the announcement.
sourceKey emitter id within the component making the announcement.

ComponentInstanceAddRequestEvent ccaffeine.ports.ContextEventPublisherService.createComponentInstanceAddRequestEvent (  in string  componentClassName,
in string  componentInstanceName,
in gov.cca.ComponentID  source,
in int  sourceKey
) 
 

Make instance request notice.

Note: event type is only: ComponentAddPending.

Parameters:
componentClassName fully qualified class name of the component type desired. There is no requirement that this name match to a loaded class anywhere.
componentInstanceName instance name of the component desired. There is no requirement that this name be 'available'.
source the component making the announcement.
sourceKey emitter id within the component making the announcement.

Make instance gone away notice.

Note: event type is only: ComponentDeleted.

Parameters:
deadComponentClassName fully qualified class name of the component deleted.
deadComponentInstanceName the name of the instance deleted.
source the component making the announcement.
sourceKey emitter id within the component making the announcement.

Note: event type is only: ComponentDeletePending.

ContextConnectionEvent ccaffeine.ports.ContextEventPublisherService.createContextConnectionEvent (  in gov.cca.ComponentID  user,
in string  userPortName,
in gov.cca.TypeMap  userPortProperties,
in gov.cca.ComponentID  provider,
in string  providerPortName,
in gov.cca.TypeMap  providerPortProperties,
in ContextEventType  cet,
in gov.cca.ComponentID  source,
in int  sourceKey
) 
 

Make ConnectionEvent in context notice.

Parameters:
user the caller component.
userPortName the caller port.
userPortProperties the callers view of the port properties, possibly null.
provider the callee component.
providerPortName the callee port.
providerPortProperties the callees view of the port properties, possibly null.
cet is one of ConnectPending, Connected, DisconnectPending, Disconnected.
source the component making the announcement.
sourceKey emitter id within the component making the announcement.

ContextEvent ccaffeine.ports.ContextEventPublisherService.createContextEvent (  in ContextEventType  ceType,
in gov.cca.ComponentID  source,
in int  sourceKey
) 
 

Create a non-specific event object.

This is as close as we get to extensible.

Parameters:
ceType int value from ContextEventType interface.
source The componentid of the component firing the event, or null if the generator is the framework itself.
sourceKey user-defined key per ContextEvent interface.
Returns:
an ContextEvent that must then be destroyed by caller when finished.

PortActivityEvent ccaffeine.ports.ContextEventPublisherService.createPortActivityEvent (  in string  portName,
in string  portType,
in ContextEventType  cet,
in gov.cca.ComponentID  source,
in int  sourceKey
) 
 

Make Port use activity notice where no connection is available.

Parameters:
portName port being fetched.
portType kind of port being fetched.
cet is one of PortFetchPending, PortFetched, PortReleasePending, PortReleased.
source the component making the announcement. assumed to be user.
sourceKey emitter id within the component making the announcement.

PortActivityEvent ccaffeine.ports.ContextEventPublisherService.createPortActivityEvent (  in gov.cca.ConnectionID  connID,
in ContextEventType  cet,
in gov.cca.ComponentID  source,
in int  sourceKey
) 
 

Make Port use activity notice for connected port.

Parameters:
connID the connection on which the activity is occuring.
cet is one of PortFetchPending, PortFetched, PortReleasePending, PortReleased.
source the component making the announcement.
sourceKey emitter id within the component making the announcement.

PortDefinitionEvent ccaffeine.ports.ContextEventPublisherService.createPortDefinitionEvent (  in gov.cca.ComponentID  component,
in string  portName,
in string  portType,
in gov.cca.TypeMap  portProperties,
in ContextEventType  cet,
in gov.cca.ComponentID  source,
in int  sourceKey
) 
 

Make Port definition event notice.

Parameters:
component the component where the affected port (will)exist(ed).
portName port instance name in component scope.
portType port class name in component scope.
portProperties the user-supplied properties of the port, which exist a little while before and after the port itself does (and may be null).
cet is one of PortAddPending, PortAdded, PortRemovePending, PortRemoved, PortRegisterPending, PortRegistered, PortUnregisterPending, PortUnregistered.
source the component making the announcement.
sourceKey emitter id within the component making the announcement.

int ccaffeine.ports.ContextEventPublisherService.fireEvent (  in ContextEvent  eData  ) 
 

The event notice deliver function.

Returns:
0 if ok, -1 if eData alleges to be a standard event type but carries insufficient information to actually be that type.
